Neural Network DRO Methods

exception dro.src.neural_model.base_nn.DROError[source]

Bases: Exception

Base exception class for all DRO-related errors.

exception dro.src.neural_model.base_nn.ParameterError[source]

Bases: DROError

Raised when invalid parameters are provided.

exception dro.src.neural_model.base_nn.DataValidationError[source]

Bases: DROError

Raised for invalid data formats or dimensions.

class dro.src.neural_model.base_nn.Linear(input_dim: int, num_classes: int)[source]

Bases: Module

Linear Model

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(X: Tensor) → Tensor[source]

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

training: bool
class dro.src.neural_model.base_nn.MLP(input_dim: int, num_classes: int, hidden_units: int = 16, activation: Module = ReLU(), dropout_rate: float = 0.1)[source]

Bases: Module

Multi-Layer Perceptron for neural network-based DRO.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(X: Tensor) → Tensor[source]

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

training: bool
class dro.src.neural_model.base_nn.BaseNNDRO(input_dim: int, num_classes: int, task_type: str = 'classification', model_type: str = 'mlp', device: device = device(type='cuda', index=0))[source]

Bases: object

Neural Network Distributionally Robust Optimization base model.

Supports both classification and regression tasks with various architectures.

criterion(outputs, labels)[source]
fit(X: Union[ndarray, Tensor], y: Union[ndarray, Tensor], train_ratio: float = 0.8, lr: float = 0.001, batch_size: int = 32, epochs: int = 100, verbose: bool = True) → Dict[str, List[float]][source]

Complete training implementation with early stopping and model checkpointing.

Parameters:

  • X – Input features

  • y – Target labels

  • train_ratio – Ratio of training data split

  • lr – Learning rate

  • batch_size – Training batch size

  • epochs – Maximum number of epochs

  • verbose – Whether to print training progress

Returns:

Training metrics dictionary

predict(X: Union[ndarray, Tensor]) → ndarray[source]

Make predictions on input data.

score(X: Union[ndarray, Tensor], y: Union[ndarray, Tensor]) → float[source]

Calculate classification accuracy.

f1score(X: Union[ndarray, Tensor], y: Union[ndarray, Tensor]) → float[source]

Calculate macro-averaged F1 score.
